Quoting  "Holliday, Donald B. (LNG-SHEP)" <dhollida@...>:
HAI......I DEVELOPED A GENERIC FRAMEWORK WITH THE HELP OF JUNIT...
IN THAT I NEED TO ACCOMODATE THE EXCEPTION TESTING...I NEED HELP IN THAT RESPECT..ALSO GIVE ME THE ADDRESS THAT HAS THE EXAMPLES
THANK U
SURESH


> I guess I'm a bit confused.  If you have a "generic Framework for
> testing",
> why don't you use your Framework instead of the JUnit Framework?
> 
> Sure you can use JUnit.  The archives from the last two months are full
> of
> examples.
> 
> Donald Holliday
> 
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: infosuresh@... [mailto:infosuresh@...]

> Subject: [junit] testing exceptions

> hi,.
> 
>     I am a newbie to junit....I have developed a generic Framework for
> testing that can be used by anyone......
> I need to test the exception handling..ie. exception should be thrown
> for a
> set of methods and exception should not be thrown for a set of methods.
> how can this be accomplished in junit..please help
> 
> thank u&regards
> Suresh
